page.title: 14Attitudes, Faceby
page.content: The area, especially Carlton Bank, faces conflict between those who live on the land and those who view it as purely recreational. The{National Park Committee is assessing the problems associated with recreational use, recently limited by fencing to retain sheep. Restriction of{car parking} affects what has always been regarded as public moorland. With one riding stable in Whorlton and others nearby, {equestrian damage}to verges and footpaths causes resentment among pedestrians and environment-conscious residents. Horse owners claim that metalled roads cause horses to slip and increase blacksmiths' bills. The site of disused poultry units as a possible permanent site for{gipsies}in the area has been suggested and is causing disquiet and some apprehension among local residents.
